intro: Primula hayaschinei, commonly known as the Hayaschine primrose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers range in color from white to pink, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in shaded, forested areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
